column4: off topic router problem.  I can no longer log into my router through firefox.  it gives me an invalid certificate error.  anyone know where my certificates are stored so I can remove it and get a new one from my router???
isn't there a link toward the bottom of that page that let's you add the exception?

no it just says try again.  and I looked in my certificates under prefernces and there is none listed.  this is not just an ubuntu problem.  firefox in windoze has the same issue.  but i can log in from internet exploder.
this all started after i updated the firmware on the router.  it must have generated a new certificate for itself????
sounds like it ... check Preferences->Advanced->View Certificates
yeah there is none listed at all in there.  except for a bunch of corporate ones.....
mine is listed under 'Servers' tab
maybe try the 'Add Exception' button and put in the address for your router if there's nothing listed in the 'Servers' tab
good idea.  same results.
not sure where to go from there... are you using http or https?
Firefox says "Your certificate contains the same serial number as another certificate issued by the certificate authority.  please get a new certificate containing a unique serial number.
i am gonna ask the #firefox channel.
thanx for the effort
yeah, that might be more helpful -- good luck
is this dd-wrt firmware?
nope stock linksys
well, not sure if it'd be the same then, but I have an entry in 'Authorities' under NewMedia-NET for mine
hey man.  you rock.
victory?
hey man.  i looked through there and there was a linksys one.  i exported it to a file and then i deleted it.  now I have the option to add an exception.
awesome! congrats   :-)
